channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2024030581
item.description:
Report E-2024030581

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-22
  • City: FLINT
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 40ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that five (5) gallons of material was released due to a load shift that resulted in one (1) 55-gallon metal drum becoming punctured. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area then wiped it down with a Simple Green. The spent material and the damaged 55- gallon metal drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024031222
item.description:
Report X-2024031222

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A wet Hazmat package was found in unload and was put in a plastic lined Hazmat spill tote and taken to QA for inspection. Inspection was done on the package and it was found to be leaking. Proper procedures were followed. DescribePack: The cap was loose on the 4L jug of Honeywell Isopropanol alcohol and the liquid leaked out into the shipping box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was contained in a plastic lined Hazmat spill tote with the orientation arrows facing up.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered to be leaking a white powder and brought to QA for processing. DescribePack: One fire extinguisher activated in transit and some contents leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a plastic lined bin to contain the leak.
